snippet: Accounts of abuse by several now-dead Horace Mann teachers have put a sharp focus on state laws that make New York among the most restrictive in limiting legal recourse in child sexual abuse cases.
abstract: Lawyers say that New York State's current restrictive statue of limitations laws are likely to block any effort to hold The Horace Mann School in the Bronx accountable for allegations of child sexual abuse, some of which are decades old; for years, efforts in Albany to liberalize the laws have failed, often encountering fierce resistance from the Roman Catholic Church and other institutions that feared financially devastating lawsuits.
lead_paragraph: Accounts of abuse by several now-dead Horace Mann teachers have put a sharp focus on state laws that make New York among the most restrictive in limiting legal recourse in child sexual abuse cases.
